availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph L. Cartwright (Pettis County, Missouri, physician and farmer)

body.p: Pettis County, Missouri, physician and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy E. Cartwright. Father of James L. Cartwright and George L. Cartwright. Married to Laura A. Mitchum Cartwright in Pettis County, Missouri, on May 13, 1861. Father of Joseph L. Cartwright and Lee Cartwright. Physician in Clark County, Kentucky, 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Clark County in 1850. Farmer in Pettis County, Missouri, in 1860. Employed Joseph Settles as an overseer in Pettis County in 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Pettis County in 1860. Physician in Pettis County in 1863.
